intro: Baskervilla boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian baskervilla, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. It is often found in rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
